keyword: how many calories is in a beef patty
title: How Many Calories in a Beef Patty?
meta_description: Discover how many calories is in a beef patty, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and simple tweaks for variations.
h1: How Many Calories in a Beef Patty?
assumptions: Standard 4 oz (113 g) ground beef patty, 80% lean/20% fat, grilled without added oil or seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by leanness, size, cooking method, and brand; check labels for precise values.

quick_answer.text: A standard beef patty contains about 290 kcal and 21 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories is in a beef patty?
faqs.a: About 290 kcal for a standard 4 oz 80% lean grilled patty.

faqs.q: What's the protein in one beef patty?
faqs.a: Approximately 21 g of protein per patty.

faqs.q: Does a beef patty have carbs?
faqs.a: No carbs, fiber, or sugars in a plain beef patty.

faqs.q: How does leanness affect calories in a beef patty?
faqs.a: Leaner patties (90%+) have fewer calories; 80% lean is around 290 kcal.

faqs.q: What about sodium in a beef patty?
faqs.a: About 75 mg naturally occurring; added salt increases it.
